Barrow-Upon-Soar to become first volunteer library, before the end of July. Other libraries confirmed to become volunteer: Castle Donington (date to be scheduled), Hathern and Kegworth (January 2016), Anstey (October 2015), Rothley (October 2015) and Sileby (December 2015). 12 libraries still do not have strong expressions of interest to be passed to unpaid so may close.
Wainfleet Library closed from 6 June. Mobile stop replaces it. Hope for volunteers to establish new library in town.

£180k p.a.  cut. Cowes, Freshwater and Ventnor libraries to be in buildings provided by others, becoming "community supported" where council provides one paid member of staff, computers, stock but everything else paid for by volunteers/community groups.  Reduction in opening hours (reducing the opening hours to 21 hours per week, in Cowes, (currently 24.5) Freshwater (currently 24.5) and Ventnor libraries (currently 24). Reduction in book fund.  Reduction in mobile service. Increased use of volunteers in all libraries. Consultation until 6th September.
Consultation ends. Council moves towards tender libraries/One Stop Shops to independent organisations.
Chair appointed to chair new Devon Libraries "independent organisation.
Roath Library may not be sold off if volunteers pay £255k in repairs.
Kirkcudbright Library to move to cheaper site.
£50k per year cut expected due to loss of mobile library. NB. This was also considered in 2014.
£600k cut expected from June 2016. Closures expected. More co-location and volunteers. Consultation October-November then second one January-March when specific proposals will be made.
£260k cut p.a. (£175k cut in bookfund) from 2015/16 with further £46k cut p.a. 2016/17. Opening hours reduced from total of 656 to 526 per week. 4 full-time-equivalent staff to be lost.

Opening hour cuts from 29 June of around one fifth in its largest nine libraries. Micklefield Library hours also reduced. Castlefield became volunteer run in 2015. £100k improvement to Buckingham Library.
£800k cut. 12-week consultation.  Options include closures, opening hours cuts, outsourcing or increasing volunteers.
At least one mobile to be withdrawn, 75 stops lost. To be implemented in April 2016.
Deep cuts to all services, statutory or otherwise – consultation to include cuts to libraries.
Judicial review court case to be heard in September or October over Rhoose Library.
Wolverhampton – £500k cut per year (from previous £1.7m spend). May be opening hour cuts (inc. Central Library), some closures, volunteers.
3 job clubs, all branches have wifi, updating of all computers, literature development e.g. Bournemouth Poet Laureate and online poetry "wall"
1 library (Eastville) closing, 6 others saved from closure but with reduced staff (£500k cut)and opening hours. £635k cuts still to be identified in other services.
£37k proposed cut to close mobile library: consultation.
Surrey – Cobham Library reopens in Cedar Centre: takes ground floor in community-group run building.
Willesden Green Library reopens after major rebuilding.
Bournemouth – 3 job clubs, all branches have wifi, updating of all computers, literature development e.g. Bournemouth Poet Laureate and online poetry "wall"
Bristol – 1 library (Eastville) closing, 6 others saved from closure but with reduced staff (£500k cut)and opening hours. £635k cuts still to be identified in other services.

Buckinghamshire – Opening hour cuts from 29 June of around one fifth in its largest nine libraries. Micklefield Library hours also reduced. Castlefield became volunteer run in 2015. £100k improvement to Buckingham Library.
Central Bedfordshire – £37k proposed cut to close mobile library: consultation.
Vale of Glamorgan – Judicial review court case to be heard in September or October over Rhoose Library.
Camden – £800k cut. 12-week consultation.  Options include closures, opening hours cuts, outsourcing or increasing volunteers.
Derby – Deep cuts to all services, statutory or otherwise – consultation to include cuts to libraries.
Brent – Willesden Green Library reopens after major rebuilding.
Dorset – At least one mobile to be withdrawn, 75 stops lost. To be implemented in April 2016.
